Sorry i should clarify. Right now i use codeanywhere for all projects that i dont need to use FTP into HubSpot. So all my WP Shopify etc work. HubSpot unfortunately doesn't support some of the advanced features code anywhere uses in FTP(such as numerous concurrent FTP sessions) and i have not yet found a completely reliable configuration in codeanywhere for that.  Though if one wanted, because HubSpot FTP is really just a facade for HubSpots apis you could definitely use the apis instead. I have not tried that yet.

I have asked HS FTP staff to try to add support for the features codeanywhere tries to use and their reply was basically as far as they know its not among the most popular FTP clients and the features its using may be difficult to support, therefore there were no plans at the time to actively try to support it

To clarify codeanywhere can connect to HubSpot ftp but sometimes has issues when navigating folders because the ftp client uses multiple connections to basically get all of the info on all of the folders in the tree as fast as possible so ftp feels instantaneous to you.
I've never had any other issues with codeanywheres ftp than with HS
haha, it’s called too much experience in emails

so KJ a few things - are you using a drag n drop or coded template? also your email is colossal. best practice - make your email 600px wide. In email clients that don’t support media queries or have limited viewports your email will look weird likely having scrolling/panning going on
you also have some oversized images in there. definitely resize them down to 600px max width accounting for the padding you have on the sides of your email

resizing that header image should also address another issue that Outlook might have, but Outlook might split that image at it’s current size to “a second page” because it uses word’s rendering engine, meaning your image might get cut in half and have a giant 300px or so gap in between the halves.

If Email isn’t your fortay I’d recommend asking for an invitation to HubSpot’s Email builder beta <#CES6JU0RY|drag-drop-email-beta> it wont solve every possible thing you want to do but gets marketers pretty close
